intro: Ouratea huberi, commonly known as the white-flowered ouratea, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ochnaceae and is characterized by its striking white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a glossy appearance. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds, aiding in its dispersal.
